body.head: Saturday April 25th 1863.
body.ab: (Looking from the window on 15th & F. st. down the Potomac, over to Arlington heights, &c &c)
body.p: The river is all a bricky mud‑color, from the heavy rains of the last two days. This color makes a decided change in its character, giving the whole scene, landscape, shores, &c. an entirely different appearance from usual.

Over on Arlington heights I see the forts, the mounds, the clusters of white tents, (they almost glisten in the fine sunshine of this morning.) Away in the southwest I see the steeple of Fairfax seminary. To the east, as I turn, Maryland hills, and the Insane Asylum.
The trees are still bare. The grass in southern exposures, however, is quite green. A fine breezy, sunny day, quite cool enough.
